column1: lunges forward and defends solidly
drifts in a quicker delivery, blocked
fired full and flat on the stumps, defended back
tossed up on middle and leg, looks to hoick this over the infield, gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
driven with the spin past cover, the timing on that is exquisite. Just leant into the drive, lovely hands.
hint of turn, he gets forward and defends
length ball on middle, defended back towards the bowler
hint of movement away from length on off stump, dabbed with soft hands
looks to force this through cover but can't pierce the gap, they scamper a single to Misbah there

right through Denly as he plays outside the line. The length ball nips back in off the seam to beat the inside edge and flatten the off stump. Denly erred in his footwork, may have been better off playing forward. In this case, he was rooted to the crease and pushed away from the body.
what balance, what wrists. Delightful timing as he works this past midwicket. So good to watch
sways out of the way of this attempted short ball outside off
drifting into middle, defended back
eased with the spin to extra cover
touch short, this skids back in, he rocks back and pulls over midwicket
eased with the spin to mid-off, nice flight, quick single. Good cricket all around
steps out to whip, this one spins away and he gets a leading edge that rolls towards point
eases this past the bowler as they jog a single to long-off
beaten by one that moves away late. Lovely delivery. No feet movement
mistimes a pull to mid-on, had to fetch it from outside off. Beaten for pace
drilled through the covers. Not all that bad a delivery, not a half-volley by any means but he punched that away through the line
gets a good stride forward and defends
slip removed, so he glides this late to beat the keeper. Deft touch, desired result.
gets on top of the bounce and dabs towards point
too short, he rocks back and wallops the pull to deep midwicket
eased with the spin to deep cover
muscled into the deep midwicket region
drills this indrifter to long-on
tickles it past short fine, too much drift down leg. Sami gives it chase and manages to pull it back in with a sharp sprint
rocks back and slaps this short ball straight to point
length on off, punched wide of cover
right behind the line as he defends this length ball on the stumps
looks to back away and slash over cover but is beaten by the slowness of the delivery
shows the full face of the bat in defence
turns this length ball on middle to the leg side
looks to force this through cover but is cramped for room, can't pierce the gap. TOP OVER.
touch short, he punches this down to long-on
nice flight, draws him forward, defended with soft hands
shapes to drive but this one doesn't turn as much, gets a thick inside edge back towards the bowler
steps out but is deceived in flight and drift, rolls off the pad to the off side as he looks to play against the turn
drifts in to take a thick inside edge to square leg as he looks to drive, superb from Shadab
wrong'un which he doesn't pick both off the hand and pitch, comes back in to hit him high on the pad.
length outside off, punched to point
clears his front leg and heaves across the line to the midwicket boundary. Not timed as well as he would've liked but got the desired result anyway
cut hard, but straight to point
worked with the angle to deep midwicket
eased into the gap towards short cover for a quick single
hint of width, he opens the bat face to punch this wide of point, down to  the sweeper
steps out and punches this shortish delivery to deep point
lunges forward and smothers this tossed up delivery back to the bowler
dipping full delivery on the stumps, turned to deep square
beaten by sharp turn, pushed this quicker, got some bite off the pitch
can't break free even as he gives him the charge, Shadab shortens his length just a touch, dabbed with the pad
punches this short delivery towards deep midwicket
short on middle, plays the short-arm jab towards deep midwicket
slants a full delivery into the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed back
pulled but on the bounce to deep midwicket
shapes to cut but doesn't quite have the room, squeezed wide of cover
steps out to pull, cramped for room so ends up skewing this towards mid-off. Flat-batted stroke
eases this into the gap at cover
drifts into middle, he rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
didn't read the googly, went for the drive, only to get a thick inside edge that flew past leg stump. Good work by Sami, sliding, tumbling stop
forces this off the backfoot to sweeper cover
turns this towards short fine. Frustration creeping in
sees this in his arc and lofts this back over the bowler's head, timed wonderfully. Can that get him going?
steps out to hoick over midwicket, ball hits the pad and deflects into the off side. They scamper through
gets a thick inside edge to fine leg. Looked to loft this over midwicket. Had a big swing at that
mistimes a pull past midwicket. Backed away to make room but the bowler followed him
toe-ends a wild slog down to deep midwicket
backs away to pull but the bowler follows him and beats him for pace. Batsman forced to sway out of the way in th end. Lovely bowling, aware of the batsman's intention. Sharp bouncer
clubbed across the line to long-on where Walton makes a right royal mess of that. Right through his legs
makes room and belts this full delivery to the deep extra cover boundary. Picked the bones out of that
makes room and punches this down to long-on
swept from way outside off towards deep backward square leg

this is a miscued slog that's in the air for a long, long time. Wide long-on and deep midwicket are underneath it and get within breathing distance of each other but mysteriously end up bottling it because no one called. Very poor from JP Duminy and Asif
turns this towards deep square where a misfield results in a second when there should've been just one
steps out and punches this length ball into the gap at deep extra cover
steps out and looks to turn this to the leg side but is beaten by the drift.
length ball on off stump, a step down before swiping this on the up. Straight to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump. Backs away and looks to go inside out and on the up. It ends up a feeble chip that lands in front of long-on
drilled by Khurram. It's a slower ball, good length on middle stump. He's had to manufacture all the pace on this slow pitch. Gets the front leg out of the way and clatters it straight
slower ball, back of a length at off stump. Backs away and slaps it on the up to long-on
short of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off from the crease
short and climbing up outside off. Backs away and looks to slice. Misses
launches him straight. Floated up on off stump, met at the pitch and creamed cleanly to clear the boundary
good length on off stump, opens his stance and punches to deep midwicket
short of a length and skidding low. It's dying on him as he pulls to deep midwicket
good length on leg stump, plants the front leg across and flicks to deep square
drags the sweep off the inside edge. Full ball on off stump, brings out the sweep hurriedly and tickles it past short fine
short and wide outside off. Dying on him again but once again he's managed to bring out all his strength, this time to smash this to the extra cover boundary
back of a length on leg stump, dragged to long-on with a flat-batted swat

taken at deep midwicket. Gets one that rises on him and cramps him near the mid-riff. He goes for the big pull over midwicket but gets under it too much. The fielder runs in and takes a composed catch
mid-off parries it to long-off and possibly saves a few runs. Misbah with the dive as the batsman backs away and slaps one past the bowler on the up
length on leg stump, dragged out to deep square off the inside half
good length on off stump, backs away and punches straight to mid-off. Can't find the gap there

loud appeal for caught-behind is followed by a review as the umpire turns it down. It's a short ball slanted across the corridor and he looks to pull. Looks like there's a tickle...yes, there's a disturbance on the replay as the ball passes bat. Ingram is caught behind
full and just outside off. Makes room and slices to sweeper cover
offcutter, good length outside off. Taps it in front of point with soft hands
slower ball, full on off stump. Looks to slog on, but it trickles down to long-on off the inside edge

stunning hit from Bopara. Steps out and spanks one on the up to beat sweeper to his right. Incredible shot to hit after coming in on this wicket. It's back of a length and wide outside off and he makes use of it
length on off stump, nudged to extra cover off the front foot

high and taken at deep midwicket. That's the end of Babar Azam. Short of a length on middle stump and it's getting clear that the pull shot is a difficult option on this pitch. He takes it on and ends up slicing it in a similar fashion to Khurram's dismissal
short of a length in the corridor, steered to third man with an open face
good length and down leg side. Can't get bat as he looks to flick
short and in the corridor. Taps it straight to point with an angled bat
pierces the off side. Length ball on off stump, gets leg side of it and punches handsomely to beat mid-off to his right
full on leg stump, punched to long-on with a full face

length on middle stump, nudged in front of long-on. He's looking to try and steal a second but Walton has done superbly to stoop down on this and fire it to Ronchi. Bopara puts in a dive and he's caught an inch short. So close but so good from Walton. Bopara nearly pulled that off
short and wide outside off, chopped straight to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, driven past the non-striker. Long-on restricts them to one
inside edge to the fine leg boundary. Full and wide from Faheem. Expansive slash from Imad without any feet. Rank bad shot, to be fair. But that races away
length on leg stump, whipped on the up to deep midwicket
shot. Good game awareness from Rizwan. Square leg was in, the ball was angled into his mid-riff and he stayed low to caress this past that fielder off the front foot
short-arm pull again, but this time he gets it straight to fine leg. Another opportunity to beat square leg, but this one had a bit more lift on it and he couldn't control the shot
bowled him! Imad gets an inside edge onto middle stump. This ball is at a hitting length but it's angled across him. He looks to play a pick-up shot over fine leg and can't get the middle on it

nicely placed again, but third man does superbly. Short and wide outside off, carefully guided to third man's right and then he's forced to sprint back hard. As he dives, he's jarred his mid-riff into the pitch and this seems to have affected his lower back. He's on the floor and in a lot of pain. That looked very uncomfortable...
nothing wrong with his spine! Brings out the full strength of his core as he bludgeons this length ball across the line and gets it past midwicket, who is inside the circle

he's cleared the fence and that's 150! What an innings this is from Rizwan. It's short of a length outside off, it's skidding on nicely and he's made perfect connection on the pull shot to get it over midwicket
oh well played, but he can't beat square leg this time. A yorker met on the full in front of middle stump and clipped deftly. Can't beat the field
short of a length outside off, backs away and pulls to long-on
goes leg side again. Misses out again. It's a full toss on the pads and the can only manage to flick this to fine leg
good length on off stump, defended into the off side
short and pushed wide. Cuts hard but backward point lunges to his left to stop it
length and floated across off stump. Hurriedly sliced to extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward point
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on on the up
good length and drifted in at middle stump. Blocked on the front foot
length ball angled into the pads. He deflects it past short fine leg off the pad. Irfan Jr. gives chase and lobs it back in awkwardly
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
full and in at leg stump, allows it to come on and this time he flicks it wide of short fine
full on the pads again, and now he tickles it to short fine's left. Amir looking for swing away that is not on right now
nicely timed straight drive. Overpitched on middle stump and it's drilled straight through the stumps at the other end
length outside off, nudged to mid-off on the up
good length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the front foot
length on the pads and it's whipped gratefully to deep square's right. He dives but the momentum takes it wider and into the boundary padding
back of a length on middle stump. Defended on the back foot
bouncer slanted across off stump. Steps out and looks to slash to clear point. Beaten
falls short of deep square. Length on leg stump and it's nicely timed clip on the up. Dies on the fielder who manages to get his body behind it and save three runs
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, thick outside edge to third man's left as he looks to defend from the crease
low full toss on middle stump and he gets the full connection this flick. Can't get it wide of midwicket, who dives low to his right to stop the boundary
one bounce and over the midwicket boundary. Short on off stump, quickly on the back foot and then a swivel to place the pull into the empty area in the deep
good length in the corridor. Dead-bats it into the pitch and responds to Duminy's call for the single
back of a length in the corridor, tapped into the point region with soft hands
ramps it over fine leg. Amir having a horrid time so far. Back of a length on the pads and he lifts it with the bounce to clear the fence
good length and in at the corridor. Opens the face and taps to point
short fine parries it to the boundary. It's Amir there. Offcutter, back of a length on the pads. He adjusts late to flick and tickles this fine. Amir leaps to his right and can't collect cleanly
short and wide outside off, backs away and looks to cut. He's beaten
sweet! A lovely pick-up shot over square leg. Full on leg stump, stands still in the crease and this is all hands as he clips it late
short of a length on off stump, dabbed aerially in front of point

another pick-up! This one off the thigh guard. Karachi straying onto the leg stump and paying every time. This is lifting up at him and he springs his knees up to adjust for the bounce and clear the boundary
all class and timing, laced through to the extra cover boundary
eases this to mid-off as they scamper a quick single
dabs this gently into the covers as they scamper a quick single
slides one back into middle and leg, whipped behind square on the leg side
drifts one into middle and leg, this is on the shorter side, Ronchi uses the depth of the crease to whip this uppishly to the square leg boundary. Wow, the power in his forearms
dabs this into the leg side for a quick single
backs away and punches this length ball to point
this is an effortless short-arm jab, dispatched to deep midwicket at the rate of knots. Straying into the body from around the wicket, this was sitting up nicely for Ronchi. Top stuff
slower length ball, Ronchi makes room, holds his shape and wallops this over the bowler's head.

this is a slap over mid-on. Backed away, the bowler followed him, cramped for room but went through with the half-baked pull. Surprised himself with how well he hit that. Half-century up. Flat-batted with disdain
swing across the line, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as the ball rolls into the off side
hops back and nudges this behind square on the leg side for an easy single
driven firmly towards wide long-off for an easy single
makes room and punches this to sweeper cover
eased with the spin towards long-on
steps out to flay that through cover but is deceived by the length, nearly chopped on
big appeal for lbw as this drifts back in to beat Ronchi's wild slog. Sliding down
punched down to long-on for an easy single
slips this down, get the direction wrong
sensational stroke this! Back of the hand floater outside off, Ronchi has the room to smack this through cover, no chance for the sweeper even though he was no more than 10 yards away from the ball
drilled down the ground but straight to mid-off
all class from JP, again. This is a back of the hand slower ball but the length is too short, Duminy uses the width to crack that behind point
lands this at length outside off, defended
looks to work this across the line, beaten. Could've so easily taken an inside edge through to the keeper on another day
slower and fuller on the pads, worked to deep square leg
full on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back
eases this down to square third man for an easy single
backs away and slaps this back of a length ball wide of cover, down to the boundary rider
slower and fuller on off stump, dabbed down towards third man

man at deep point will watch this bump into the boundary at sweeper cover. This is a juicy full toss, Ronchi was well outside leg in trying to back away when he met that and walloped it away. The wheels are well and truly coming off
this has been whipped from outside off towards deep midwicket
hit me delivery angling down leg, Ronchi simply helps this past short fine.
lifter from length on middle, he gets on top of the bounce and bunts it into the leg side for a quick single
angles a length ball across the left hander, Duminy runs it down to third man
right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, squeezed back. The bowler fires a throw towards Ronchi, who has to duck out of the way. Glares exchanged

excellent reflex-action catch on his followthrough. This is a full toss on middle, Ronchi made room to go over the bowler's head but ended up hitting it straight back. Irfan struck his right hand out to pluck that even as the momentum took him forward. You feel, however, that Ronchi's blitz tonight has well and truly taken the game away from Karachi.
appeal for caught behind as he looks to slash, bu here was no bat
back-of-the-hand slower ball that took ages to arrive, JP looks to run it down but ends up dabbing it towards the keeper instead
drifting down leg, helped towards fine leg
angles in a length ball in from wide of the crease, run down towards third man
drifting into middle and leg, helped down to fine leg
another slower ball outside off, steered wide of point
once again steers this down towards third man for an easy single
crunched on the up to sweeper cover
gentle tap into the off side for a quick single
angles a length ball across JP, who defends
right behind the line in defence again
steers this away-going length ball to backward point again
shapes to drive firmly, toe-ends it to cover.
angles in a length ball on the stumps, keeps a touch low but JP is solid in defence
steers this short of length delivery towards square third man
full on middle, belted down past the diving long-on fielder. It was a poor delivery. Intended to be a yorker, turned out to be a full toss. Deserved to be whacked

the angle has done the trick. Amir slants this back in at length from wide of the crease, there's a hint of deviation away as it beats the outside edge to crash into the stumps. Talat was looking to run this down
hint of width, cut down to square third man
shapes to pull but lets it go in the end as Amir banged this in outside off
slants back a length ball from wide of the crease, defended
down on one knee as he sends this full toss screaming to the cover boundary. Poor ball
swung away to the leg side, on the bounce to the man at deep midwicket
uses the pace to steer this length ball outside off towards third man
on middle and leg at length, kept a touch low but he's firmly behind the line as he works it to deep square
firm drive towards wide mid-off for a quick single
eases the drive to sweeper cover
touch full on off from around the stumps, defended towards point
swung across the line, hit really hard. Beats deep square to the boundary. This was a mow that raced across the turf

dropped by Babar Azam at long-on. Everyone had their hands on their heads in the aftermath. He looks to loft through the line, but ends up dragging it towards wide long-on where Babar was on the move as this descended. Should'e been taken
excellent comeback, right into the blockhole, kept out
the pull from outside off towards deep midwicket
looks to mow this across the line, gets a thick inside edge that races to the fine leg boundary
Mills has put down a sitter! He called for this skier, a mistimed slog, didn't have to move much but he may have lost the ball as it came down. Very poor.
slaps this short ball to deep point

cramped for room as he looks to work this off his hip but the ball deflects off the right thigh and beats the keeper to the third man boundary. They've referred it upstairs, but ball tracking shows this would've missed the stumps
slower ball that takes an age to get to the batsman, the direction's down leg as well and it rolls to the keeper
another slower length ball, helped down to fine leg
too short and on leg stump, he uses the depth of the crease to whip this behind square to the fine leg fence
steps out to smack this outside the ground but ends up smashing a thick inside edge onto the pad as it rolls back towards the bowler

he's nailed this though and this has bounced onto the road outside the ground, towards the wide long-on area. What a hit, made a crunching sound as bat met ball. This has been an absolute hiding for Karachi Kings
